result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

4:04 PM Defendant John J Gfesser in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for John J Gfesser.  Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case was set for plea and sentencing, but Atty Kershek wishes to change course.

In cases 22CM454, 22CM455, and 22CM1103:
Defense moves to enter a special plea of NGI and requests an NGI Evaluation under 971.16 be ordered.  Court Grants and order an NGI Evaluation under 971.16.  Court will Appoint Behavioral Consultants.   Evaluation to be filed by 11/23/22.

Case 22CM1305 tagsalong. 
Defendant will provide updated cell phone number to the court.
Review hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

3:15 PM Defendant John J Gfesser in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for John J Gfesser.  Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called for plea and sentencing. State has complied with victim's rights. 
State reads offer into the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.
Court goes off the record for a few minutes to allow the Defense to review the complaint prior to completion of colloquy. 
Court discontinues the plea colloquy to allow for the Defendant to stabilize on new medications.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:38 PM Defendant John J Gfesser in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office, but Attorney Nimmer states the defendant was evaluated within the last 90 days and will likely still qualify as he states his financial circumstances have not changed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Public Defenders office will evaluate the defendant prior to the next date.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 07/25/2022.
